strings.Value: "If you stop attacking me, I won't hurt you."
[Kill the Horned Hunter] "There is no point in letting the enemy's servant live. Die!"
"I'm not here to kill you — but to stop you. And heal you, if there's any hope of that."
"Call me whatever you want, Nyrissa. But your most loyal servants are defeated, your power is gone. Surrender!"
[Attack] "Enough talking. Let's end this now!"
"You must be punished for your many atrocities. If you have anything to say first — speak now."
"There cannot be two rulers in the Stolen Lands. Bow to me, and I may spare your life."
"Evil only begets more evil, but there must be a way to stop it. Trust me. Stop. A battle will not solve or help anything."
"Well, since there is no other way — let's settle this in battle."

{n}The Horned Hunter, chained to a tree, raises his head with difficulty, and fixes his eyes on you.{/n} "You! The mistress punished me for failing to deal with you. And look — her favorites, the Knurly Witch and the Wriggling Man have also failed!"

"Think not of me, {name}," {n}says the Horned Hunter in a strangely cold voice.{/n} "Did I not tell you that the shadow behind your back is always Her? And the sound of footsteps in the dark — always Her? Turn around!"

{n}The Horned Hunter twists in his shackles, but in vain — the steel cuts through his body, and dark blood pours from the wound. The creature rattles and rests forever, but with his final breath, speaks in a strangely cold voice:{/n} "Did I not tell you that the shadow behind your back is always Her? And the sound of footsteps in the dark — always Her? Turn around!"

{n}You can't tell by the nymph's appearance whether she is calm or excited, frightened or angry. Nyrissa barely looks at you. She stops by the Apology and runs a finger along its rim.{/n} "My hound. You have run so long, to finally meet your mistress."

"What hope do you speak of? There isn't any in the world, nor was there ever. Evil and sorrow are masters of our lives. Let's get this over with. Either I kill you and get the last grain of dust for the Apology — or you kill me and carry the memory of Nyrissa and her despair with you, for the rest of your brief life!"
"Oh, if only you knew what punishment is! But you don't. And you never will. I shall take your life, and transform it into the last grain of dust in my cup!'

"You are still in my kingdom, silly child. And the kingdom is alive while its ruler draws breath. That's true for both of us, isn't it? I won't step back — not now, when you've come to me yourself to fill my cup!"
"I've seen sunrises on two worlds and sunsets over a thousand kingdoms, silly child. I couldn't bow to a day-fly, even if it is lucky enough to defeat me!"
"Run! — Run, my hound. Run to your death!"

{n}Nyrissa looks at you askance, then drops her head.{/n} "Oh, if only you could know, {name}... how tired I am... After thousands of years in this insane dance of lies and destruction... can I believe that anything will ever be better again? No, no, it's all in vain! I don't want to fight — but is there anything left to hope for? No future. No life. No redemption." {n}Nyrissa lifts her eyes, defeated and broken.{/n} "I surrender..."
"Then goodbye... {name}. Whoever wins, it will be the end of the other!"
